sexpression

Class ByteArrayBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sexpression.ByteArrayBuffer

  • public class ByteArrayBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrap a collection of byte arrays. These "arrays" that are collected are each also wrapped. This class exists for the purpose of minimizing byte-by-byte copying of an arrays for the purpose of aggregating several of them over time. If the final array value isn't needed until the very end of some long-running, multi-function process, the intermediate values can simply be stored as a collection of wrapped arrays, rather than copying every byte at each stage of the intermediate format changing.

      • append

        public void append(byte b)
        Append a single byte to the list. This will create a single-element array and add this array to the list.
        Parameters:
        b - Add this byte to the list.

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Copy each array in the collection to a buffer of bytes (in order).
        Returns:
        This method returns a byte array such that the array will consist of the bytes from each byte-array in the collection, in the order that they were appended.
